snippet: Park City Mountain Resort was at the center of an eviction battle that ended with its sale to Vail Resorts, which operates an adjacent ski area.
abstract: Vail Resorts buys Park City Mountain Resort in Utah for $182.5 million, ending long dispute and clearing away threat that eviction battle could have shuttered ski resort for season or created enough uncertainty to scare away tourists.
lead_paragraph: Park City Mountain Resort was at the center of an eviction battle that ended with its sale to Vail Resorts, which operates an adjacent ski area.

headline.main: Sale in Utah Ends Fears of a Crimp in Tourism
headline.print_headline: Sale in Utah Ends Fears of a Crimp in Tourism
